comment.author: 62550845@N07
comment._content:
Unveiled at the Paris Air Show in June 1995 was Teledyne Ryan's Penetrator UAV, a completely new, company-funded, multipurpose design with two versions being foreseen: a subsonic UAV, the Penetrator-TFM (TFM = Tactical Force Multiplier), and the supersonic Penetrator-T (T = target), which used the same wings, tail and propulsion unit, but had a slightly shorter fuselage. Both versions has a multi-faceted, stealthy fuselage, with shoulder-mounted wings, and twin fins angled sharply outwards. In order to minimise the radar cross-section (RCS) the engine was mounted low in the fuselage, and, while, the twin air intakes are in the conventional cheek position, the exhaust is above the fuselage and between the fins.

Source: Jane's International Defence Review (Aug 01, 1995)
